verses.verse: And it came<WG1096> to pass, as he went<WG2064> into<WG1519> the house<WG3624> of one<WG5100> of the chief<WG758> Pharisees<WG5330> to eat<WG5315> bread<WG740> on the sabbath<WG4521> day, that they watched<WG3906> him.
And, behold,<WG2400> there was a certain<WG5100> man<WG444> before<WG1715> him which had the dropsy.<WG5203>
And Jesus<WG2424> answering<WG611> spoke<WG2036> to the lawyers<WG3544> and Pharisees,<WG5330> saying,<WG3004> Is it lawful<WG1832> to heal<WG2323> on the sabbath<WG4521> day?
And they held<WG2270> their peace.<WG2270> And he took<WG1949> him, and healed<WG2323> him, and let him go;<WG630>

And answered<WG611> them, saying,<WG2036> Which<WG5101> of you shall have an ass<WG3688> or<WG2228> an ox<WG1016> fallen<WG1706> into<WG1519> a pit,<WG5421> and will not straightway<WG2112> pull<WG385> him out on<WG1722> the sabbath<WG4521> day? <WG2250>
And they could<WG2480> not answer<WG470> him again<WG470> to these<WG5023> things.

And he put<WG3004> forth<WG3004> a parable<WG3850> to those<WG3588> which were bidden,<WG2564> when he marked<WG1907> how<WG4459> they chose<WG1586> out the chief<WG4411> rooms;<WG4411> saying<WG3004> to them.

When<WG3752> you are bidden<WG2564> of any <WG5100> man<WG444> to a wedding,<WG1062> sit<WG2625> not down<WG2625> in the highest<WG4411> room;<WG4411> lest<WG3379> a more honorable<WG1784> man<WG444> than you be bidden<WG2564> of him;

And he that bade<WG2564> you and him come<WG2064> and say<WG2046> to you, Give<WG1325> this<WG5129> man<WG444> place;<WG5117> and you begin<WG756> with shame<WG152> to take<WG2722> the lowest<WG2078> room. <WG5117>

But when<WG3752> you are bidden,<WG2564> go<WG4198> and sit<WG377> down<WG377> in the lowest<WG2078> room;<WG5117> that when<WG3752> he that bade<WG2564> you comes,<WG2064> he may say<WG2036> to you, Friend,<WG5384> go<WG4320> up higher:<WG511> then<WG5119> shall you have<WG2071> worship<WG1391> in the presence<WG1799> of them that sit<WG4873> at<WG4873> meat with you.
For whoever <WG3956> <WG3588> exalts<WG5312> himself<WG1438> shall be abased;<WG5013> and he that humbles<WG5013> himself<WG1438> shall be exalted. <WG5312>

Then<WG1161> said<WG3004> he also<WG2532> to him that bade<WG2564> him, When<WG3752> you make<WG4160> a dinner<WG712> or<WG2228> a supper,<WG1173> call<WG5455> not your friends,<WG5384> nor<WG3364> your brothers,<WG80> neither<WG3366> your kinsmen,<WG4773> nor <WG3364> your rich<WG4145> neighbors;<WG1069> lest<WG3379> they also<WG2532> bid<WG479> you again,<WG479> and a recompense<WG468> be made<WG1096> you.
But when<WG3752> you make<WG4160> a feast,<WG1403> call<WG2564> the poor,<WG4434> the maimed,<WG376> the lame,<WG5560> the blind: <WG5185>
And you shall be blessed;<WG3107> for they cannot <WG3756> <WG2192> recompense<WG467> you: for you shall be recompensed<WG467> at<WG1722> the resurrection<WG386> of the just. <WG1342>

And when one<WG5100> of them that sat<WG4873> at<WG4873> meat with him heard<WG191> these<WG5023> things, he said<WG2036> to him, Blessed<WG3107> is he that shall eat<WG5315> bread<WG740> in the kingdom<WG932> of God.<WG2316>
Then<WG1161> said<WG2036> he to him, A certain<WG5100> man<WG444> made<WG4160> a great<WG3173> supper,<WG1173> and bade<WG2564> many: <WG4183>
And sent<WG649> his servant<WG1401> at supper<WG1173> time<WG5610> to say<WG2036> to them that were bidden,<WG2564> Come;<WG2064> for all<WG3956> things are now<WG2235> ready. <WG2092>

And they all<WG3956> with one <WG3391> consent began<WG756> to make<WG3868> excuse.<WG3868> The first<WG4413> said<WG2036> to him, I have bought<WG59> a piece of ground,<WG68> and I must<WG2192> needs<WG318> go<WG1831> and see<WG1492> it: I pray<WG2065> you have<WG2192> me excused. <WG3868>
And another<WG2087> said,<WG2036> I have bought<WG59> five<WG4002> yoke<WG2201> of oxen,<WG1016> and I go<WG4198> to prove<WG1381> them: I pray<WG2065> you have<WG2192> me excused. <WG3868>
And another<WG2087> said,<WG2036> I have married<WG1060> a wife,<WG1135> and therefore <WG122> <WG5124> I cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> come. <WG2064>

So<WG2532> that servant<WG1401> came,<WG3854> and showed<WG518> his lord<WG2962> these<WG5023> things. Then<WG5119> the master<WG3617> of the house<WG3617> being angry<WG3710> said<WG2036> to his servant,<WG1401> Go<WG1831> out quickly<WG5030> into<WG1519> the streets<WG4113> and lanes<WG4505> of the city,<WG4172> and bring<WG1521> in here<WG5602> the poor,<WG4434> and the maimed,<WG376> and the halt,<WG5560> and the blind. <WG5185>
And the servant<WG1401> said,<WG2036> Lord,<WG2962> it is done<WG1096> as you have commanded,<WG2004> and yet<WG2089> there is room. <WG5117>

And the lord<WG2962> said<WG2036> to the servant,<WG1401> Go<WG1831> out into<WG1519> the highways <WG1327> <WG3598> and hedges,<WG5418> and compel <WG315> them to come<WG1525> in, that my house<WG3624> may be filled. <WG1072>
For I say<WG3004> to you, That none<WG3762> of those<WG1565> men<WG435> which<WG3588> were bidden<WG2564> shall taste<WG1089> of my supper. <WG1173>
And there went<WG4848> great<WG4183> multitudes<WG3793> with him: and he turned,<WG4762> and said<WG2036> to them,

If<WG1487> any <WG1536> man come<WG2064> to me, and hate<WG3404> not his father,<WG3962> and mother,<WG3384> and wife,<WG1135> and children,<WG5043> and brothers,<WG80> and sisters,<WG79> yes,<WG2089> and his own<WG1438> life<WG5590> also,<WG2532> he cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> be my disciple. <WG3101>
And whoever<WG3748> does not bear<WG941> his cross,<WG4716> and come<WG2064> after<WG3694> me, cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> be my disciple. <WG3101>

For which<WG5101> of you, intending<WG2309> to build<WG3618> a tower,<WG4444> sits<WG2523> not down<WG2523> first,<WG4412> and counts<WG5585> the cost,<WG1160> whether<WG1487> he have <WG2192> sufficient to finish <WG535> it?

Lest <WG2443> <WG3361> haply,<WG3379> after he has laid<WG5087> the foundation,<WG2310> and is not able<WG2480> to finish <WG1615> it, all<WG3956> that behold <WG2334> it begin<WG756> to mock<WG1702> him,
Saying,<WG3004> This<WG3778> man<WG444> began<WG756> to build,<WG3618> and was not able<WG2480> to finish. <WG1615>

Or<WG2228> what<WG5101> king,<WG935> going<WG4198> to make<WG4820> war<WG4171> against another<WG2087> king,<WG935> sits<WG2523> not down<WG2523> first,<WG4412> and consults<WG1011> whether<WG1487> he be able<WG1415> with ten<WG1176> thousand<WG5505> to meet<WG528> him that comes<WG2064> against<WG1909> him with twenty<WG1501> thousand? <WG5505>
Or<WG1161> else,<WG1490> while the other<WG846> is yet<WG2089> a great<WG4183> way<WG4206> off,<WG631> he sends<WG649> an ambassador,<WG4242> and desires<WG2065> conditions<WG4314> of peace. <WG1515>
So<WG3767> likewise,<WG3779> whoever<WG3956> he be of you that forsakes<WG657> not all<WG3956> that he has,<WG5224> he cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> be my disciple. <WG3101>
Salt <WG217> is good:<WG2570> but if<WG1437> the salt<WG217> have lost<WG3471> his flavor,<WG3471> with which <WG1722> <WG5101> shall it be seasoned? <WG741>
It is neither<WG3777> fit<WG2111> for the land,<WG1095> nor<WG3777> yet for the dunghill; <WG2874> but men cast<WG906> it out. He that has<WG2192> ears<WG3775> to hear,<WG191> let him hear. <WG191>
